results.title: Pentuphouse
results.creator_credit: Anthony Anderson, Red Carpet Productions, Australian Film Commission and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description: Della is an ageing jazz singer who is in a destructive relationship with petty crim and drug user, Dale. This haunting and confident short film examines the betrayals and compromises of love and age. The cinematography and script are first rate and the performances by Gillian Jones and Aaron Blabey outstanding. Cast also includes Stephen Curry.

results.title: Pentridge: some ghosts and memories from the big house
results.creator_credit: Daniel Scharf, Daniel Scharf Productions and Catherine Birmingham
results.brief_description: An evocative record of Pentridge prison, one of Australia’s most infamous penal establishments. The notorious criminal Mark ‘Chopper’ Read joins author Ray Mooney and former guards, governors and fellow inmates to relate stories of the harsh conditions and camaraderie shared by prisoners until the prison’s closure in the early nineties.
results.title_for_label: Pentridge: some ghosts and memories from the big house

results.title: Penny serenade [DVD]
results.brief_description: Leaving her husband, a woman contemplating divorce recollects in a series of flashbacks the story of her courtship and marriage, the shattering loss of her unborn child, financial struggles, and the emotional upheaval of adopting a child. Stars Irene Dunn and Cary Grant.

results.brief_description: Penny, aged about 18, is partially blind and has been attending the Lethbridge Rehabilitation Centre where Ann, her occupational therapist, works on a programme of activities for daily living.

results.title: Penitentiary
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, Ronald Weyman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A report on life and conditions in one of Canada’s penal institutions, illustrating current trends in the treatment of criminals. Defiant and contemptuous of society, a young first offender is brought to a federal penitentiary. The film shows the descipline, the confinement and the rigid routines which are part of a prisoner’s expiation for crime. It also deals with the challenge, now recognized by penitentiary authorities - either to change the prisoner into a law-abiding citizen or to have them come back a repeater - and with the new psychological approach which endeavours to determine the basic causes of a person’s wrong-doing.

results.title: Penicillin: the magic bullet
results.creator_credit: Arcimedia, Claire Jager and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: In 1945 the Nobel Prize for medicine was awarded to three men - Alexander Fleming, Ernst Chain, and the Australian, Howard Florey - as the inventors of penicillin, the “magic bullet” of medicine. This doumentary tells the true story behind the discovery of penicillin, the wonder drug of the twentieth century, which would change the face of modern civilisation by providing a cure for medical scourges such as pneumonia, meningitis, rheumatic fever, septicaemia and venereal diseases. Using dramatic re-enactments, “Penicillin : the magic bullet” charts the work of the Howard Florey’s team (including that of the overlooked Norman Heatley) as they struggled towards this medical breakthrough. Narrated by Martin Jacobs.
